summary: The diff implements the three core requirements: REQ-1 (3 line item rows in Transaction tab), REQ-2 (line items flow to Invoice tab with VAT rate resolution), and REQ-3 (remove item type dropdown). App.tsx correctly defines LineItemEntry, manages shared state, and passes lineItems to both Transaction and Invoice. Transaction.tsx imports VAT_CATEGORIES and renders 3 rows. Invoice.tsx receives lineItems and includes VAT rate derivation logic. However, because the Invoice.tsx diff is truncated, it is not possible to fully confirm REQ-2 display details or REQ-3 dropdown removal in the rendered JSX.

missing_requirements.requirement: Empty/unfilled line item rows (where net amount is blank or zero) are omitted from the Invoice line items
missing_requirements.reason: Invoice.tsx is truncated and the filtering logic for empty/zero net amount rows cannot be confirmed in the visible diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Each line item in Invoice tab shows: description, net amount, VAT category label, and resolved VAT rate percentage
missing_requirements.reason: Invoice.tsx is truncated before the JSX rendering section, so it cannot be confirmed that all four fields are visibly rendered per row.

missing_requirements.requirement: No dropdown selector appears for Invoice Item type in the Invoice tab line items section; item description is displayed as static/read-only text
missing_requirements.reason: Invoice.tsx is truncated before the line items rendering JSX, so the removal of the dropdown and replacement with read-only text cannot be confirmed from the diff.
